title: The_funnycrab
author: The_funnycrab
content: Hi forum peoplePlease don't mind my typing skill and pattern but I have been snooping around this community for some time and still haven't certainly understood the whole website because the whole system seems very confusing. There is this current surge of Bitcoin boom going on in my place and I feel like am left behind and so I have been asking alot of questions and some of my colleagues are actually tired of me because I ask alot of crazy questions some time.And there deem it fit that I should ask this question in a place where I can be fully corrected and guided so I asked for link of Bitcoin website this one was given to me.Please all I want to know Is the basics and how can I benefits from this Bitcoin that is exploding everywhere.

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: Well welcome to Bitcointalk mate, it nice having you here. There nothing to be confused about here mate. This is the world of decentralization. To clear things a bit for you, I will recommend you go through the Bitcoin white paper by it original creator, Satoshi Nakomoto https://bitcoin.org/en/bitcoin-paper  it has been translated to over 43 languages so if you aren't an English speacker, you can try checking out if you local language is amongst the translated versions.Here's also a Bitcoin book on GitHub, you may also want to check out https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chapters Feel free to ask any questions you find confusing here on the forum, there are tons of experts here to put you through.

comments.author: Mr.suevie
comments.body: Welcome mate, Well I understand how the forum can be especially if you are a newbie here but you can check out the pin thread up top of this board for some clarity and try this if it would help Abit https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1629118.0And I would like to encourage you more on asking of questions because questions are actually the gateway to many solutions and new ideas too so your stay here should also be the one filled with lots of questions and trying making some research out by yourself and compare the answers you get here in the community.

comments.author: Orpichukwu
comments.body: Quote from: The_funnycrab on October 15, 2023, 05:43:31 PMPlease all I want to know Is the basics and how can I benefits from this Bitcoin that is exploding everywhere.Welcome to the forum, and it's indeed a forum for bitcoin, and you can get your answers regarding things that you are not familiar with here. Just ask the question, and people will answer you. First, before you think about benefiting from Bitcoin, I will advise you to learn how what you want to benefit from works first so that you don't get more confused than you already are right now. So I will like you to browse through the forum, use the search option, and search for familiar questions like the history of bitcoin, how it works, it's nature, and you will have a lot of material to study about it. Another thing is that don't conceive in your mind that you can make fast money from bitcoin, as that might end up misleading you and you getting disappointed by the result. It's a means of investment, but the profit doesn't come real quick. Only those who are patient enough to hold for long enjoy the reward, so whatever you do, don't add get rich quick as one thing you want to enjoy from it.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: You can try to start with https://learnmeabitcoin.com/ and https://bitcoin.org/en/ as they are beginner friendly.In case you wanna look for more resources, try at https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information.htmlHow can you benefit from the technology? depends on what you want/can. I myself went with the easy route of just hodling in hopes for the value to increase over time and as a fall back plan for the growing inflation.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: The_funnycrab on October 15, 2023, 05:43:31 PMHi forum people~Welcome to the forum, The_funnycrabI get that the website can seem confusing at first.  It is basically an online chatroom where people talk about Bitcoin and crypto.  Theres thousands of users on here discussing about all kinds of stuff  and  I was confused too when I first found it.  But you already found the Beginners & Help section, so that is a good start.  Just check around the threads and see what people are talking about.  Reading through some of the conversations can help you learn the basics better than anything else.  This place is great for newbies who want to put in the time to understand cryptocurrencies.  As you start to get it, you can join in the talks, ask your own questions and help out others.  It just takes time and effort to wrap your head around this stuff.  But the more you learn, the more you can contribute to the community here.  Were happy to help newcomers figure it all out.

comments.author: DaNNy001
comments.body: Quote from: The_funnycrab on October 15, 2023, 06:56:33 PMPlease I want to reply the chat of other members and put it inside a box like the way other are doing so I can properly express myself better and give better details to what I want to highlight.That's a good observation mate, for a newbie and I think this is pretty simple. Just click the quote button in the actual reply of the person you want to reply and edit out the actual chat you don't want and then write at the bottom of the chat and then post the reply of yours.

comments.author: jrrsparkles
comments.body: Quote from: The_funnycrab on October 15, 2023, 06:56:33 PMPlease I want to reply the chat of other members and put it inside a box like the way other are doing so I can properly express myself better and give better details to what I want to highlight.Just click the quote button of the post that you want to reply which you can find in the left top corner of that post.  Then type your reply that you want to then click the post button at the bottom of the box.If you want to reply to multiple posts in one then just do then copy all those posts into one box with respective quotes and start write your reply to each one at the end of [/quote].

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: The_funnycrab on October 15, 2023, 06:56:33 PMPlease I want to reply the chat of other members and put it inside a box like the way other are doing so I can properly express myself better and give better details to what I want to highlight.If you still don’t understand how the quoting works then I’ll recommend one of the best tutorials you’ll see online, which is a tutorial video by steamtyme: Bitcointalk.org - Post Formatting

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: Quote from: The_funnycrab on October 15, 2023, 06:56:33 PMPlease I want to reply the chat of other members and put it inside a box like the way other are doing so I can properly express myself better and give better details to what I want to highlight.Just click on the "quote" button next to the post you want to reply to, and then make your own post below "[/quote]", mind you that you don't have to quote the entire post you're replying to, clear out the part you don't need and leave only what you want to reply to. If you want to reply to all what the user posted, but their post is long, clear it all out and replace it with something like "snip". Here is a thread on how to avoid pyramid quote: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=3749076.msg37016589#msg37016589Quote from: The_funnycrab on October 15, 2023, 05:43:31 PMso I asked for link of Bitcoin website this one was given to me.This isn't a Bitcoin website per se, this is a Bitcoin discussion forum. Bitcoin doesn't have a website.Quote from: The_funnycrab on October 15, 2023, 05:43:31 PMPlease all I want to know Is the basics and how can I benefits from this Bitcoin that is exploding everywhere.What do you want to benefit from Bitcoin, do you want to be your own bank? Or you were told you can become rich overnight through Bitcoin?

comments.author: mamesso
comments.body: Welcome to the Bitcointalk forum, a warm welcome is always given by the more senior members of the forum to newcomers who want to learn about Bitcoin. Now you are in the right place, here you can get all valid information about Bitcoin.There are many things you can do here to increase your knowledge about Bitcoin, here you can ask about something you don't know, you can also discuss directly with other users who are discussing Bitcoin developments. You will get a lot of benefits here as long as you diligently read several threads that have been directed at you, try stopping by here to find out more about safe Bitcoin storage places.
